page.title: 04Farming-Reculver Oyster Farm
page.content: Reculver Oyster farm is situated right next to the sea wall at Reculver.Four children visited the farm.The farm breeds mostly oysters.The first stage is collecting the oysters eggs.A male and female oyster are put into a bowl of water, the female lays about one hundred thousand eggs at a time.The male gives off a kind of black dust.When these eggs are fertilized they are put on to trays full of water. They are so small they can only be seen under a microscope.Mr John Bays who owns the oyster farm showed us around and also put some of these tiny eggs under the microscope for us to look at.The oyster eggs are left on the trays to grow,each tray contains about two million eggs.After a few days the eggs have grown enough to be moved into larger tanks because now they need to feed or they would no longer develop.
